question: def greatest_divisor(x,y): """Compute the greatest common divisor of x and y""" while y > 0: x, y = y, x % y return x
answer: public static int greatest_divisor(int val1, int val2) { int temp; while (val2 != 0) { temp = val2; val2 = val1 % val2; val1 = temp; } return val1; }

question: def isUnivalTree(self, root: TreeNode) -> bool: if not root: return True if root.right and root.val != root.right.val: return False if root.left and root.val != root.left.val: return False return self.isUnivalTree(root.right) and self.isUnivalTree(root.left)
answer: public boolean isUnivalTree(TreeNode root) { if(root == null) return true; if(root.left !=null){ if(root.left.val != root.val || !isUnivalTree(root.left)) return false; } if(root.right != null){ if(root.right.val != root.val || !isUnivalTree(root.right)) return false; } return true; }

answer: @InverseMethod("toInteger") public static String toText(SimplePropertyFormUnit unit, Integer previousValue, Integer currentValue) { if (currentValue == null) { return unit.getValue().toString(); } return String.valueOf(currentValue); }

question: def IsWholeNumber(txt): try: int(txt) return True except ValueError: return False
answer: public static boolean isWholeNumber(String txt) { try { Integer.parseInt(txt); return true; } catch (NumberFormatException ex) { return false; } }

question: def has_alarm_present(self): try: self.navigator.switch_to_alert() except NoAlertPresentException as err: return False return True
answer: public static boolean hasAlarmExisting(FirefoxDriver browser) { try { browser.switchTo().alert(); return true; } catch (NoAlertPresentException err) { return false; } }

question: def is_ordered(self, arr): for idx in range(1, len(arr)): if arr[idx] < arr[idx - 1]: return False return True
answer: private static boolean isOrdered(Comparable[] arr) { for (int idx = 1; idx < arr.length; idx++) if (less(arr[idx], arr[idx - 1])) return false; return true; }

question: def destroy(bc): if bc != None: bc.unpersist # bc.destroy
answer: public void destroy() { if (connection != null && connection.isConnected()) { connection.disconnect(); } }

question: def withdraw(self, amount): '''Method to withdraw amount from the balance''' if amount < self._balance: self._balance -= amount return True else: return False
answer: public boolean withdraw(int account, long money) { account--; if (!isValid(account) || arr[account] < money) { return false; } arr[account] -= money; return true; }

question: def check_login_status(self): if self.fetch_current_user_logged() != None: return True else: return False
answer: public boolean verifyLogin() { List<UserLocalData> userCollection = DataSupport.findAll(UserLocalData.class); if (userCollection.size() != 0) { return true; } else { return false; } }

question: def elevation(self) -> int: """Returns the cell height.""" elevation = 0 while self.table.cells[(self.row + elevation, self.col)] == self.cell_id: elevation += 1 return elevation
answer: private int elevation(TreeNode branch) { int elevation = 0; while (branch != null) { elevation += 1; branch = branch.left; } return elevation; }

question: def _deregister(self): """Undo the enrollment done in _register if it was ever done.""" if self._registry_info is not None: del self._registry_info[0][self._registry_info[1]]
answer: public void deregister(final PhantomReference<? extends Object> itemRef) { if (itemRef != null) { /* Just skip if no reference is passed*/ refs.remove(itemRef); itemRef.clear(); } }
